author: archyworldyscom
title: Paralympic Games 2024 / “Bronze” Christina Gentzou – First medal for Greece (video)
text:
This is Greece’s first medal in the event on the second day of the Games, but at the same time the first medal in the sport of Tae Kwon Do.
The story was written on Friday evening (8/30) by Cristina Genzu Also won the bronze medal at the Paris Paralympics in his sport Tae Kwon Do . That’s all Greece’s first medal in the event only the second day of the Games, but at the same time and the first medal in the sport of Tae Kwon Do which was first introduced at the Paris Games.
The Greek athlete defeated China’s Yinan Yao 14-4 in the 65 kg category (K44 category), putting together a stunning match. Playing smart and hitting on the counterattack, 19-year-old Genju started to accumulate points and took a 12-2 lead with one minute to go. The Chinese tried to react but the match ended 14-4 in favor of the Greeks.
Christina Gentzu’s excitement after the end of the match was evident and celebrated by winning the medal by doing a victory lap with her coach Evangelia Evangeliloglou, holding the Greek flag.
In her first statements after receiving the medal, the 19-year-old athlete spoke of an incredible experience and energy, declaring herself proud to live it. When the journalist asked her what is most intense in her, she typically said that “all the emotions that I have not felt in all my years, I felt them in this event. And sadness, sadness, joy and support … “.
#Paralympic #Games #Bronze #Christina #Gentzou #medal #Greece #video
2024-09-05 17:30:17

author: financialcontent.com
title: The Evolving Environmental Benefits of Opting for a Pre-Owned Phone or Laptop | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Photo from Unsplash Originally Posted On: https://store.adventinteractive.com/blog/the-evolving-environmental-benefits-of-opting-for-a-preowned-phone-or-laptop.html
“A small step for you, a giant leap for environmental conservation. Every refurbished device is a powerful choice for a greener tomorrow.”
Many people tend to buy brand-new gadgets, but there’s a significant shift toward choosing pre-owned phones or laptops. These are previously owned devices that have been carefully checked, fixed, and restored to a condition that’s almost as good as new. Opting for a refurbished laptop or phone not only helps your wallet but also benefits the environment. The United Nations notes that electronics contribute to around 50 million tons of e-waste yearly. Reusing electronics by refurbishment cuts down on e-waste and saves natural resources. The UN report highlights that refurbishing a million smartphones can conserve 16,000 tons of materials such as gold, silver, and rare earth elements. Moreover, using a refurbished smartphone can lower greenhouse gas emissions by about 45 kg CO2 compared to producing a new one. Similarly, the European Union’s research indicates that refurbished laptops are less taxing on the environment than new ones, potentially reducing negative environmental effects by 60%.
The Environmental Impact of Electronics: Comparing New and Refurbished This opening discussion aims to dissect the environmental impact of both new and refurbished laptops and phones, casting light on a critical yet often overlooked aspect of our modern tech-driven world.
New Electronics and the Environment New electronic gadgets necessitate significant use of precious resources—metals, plastics—and energy-consuming manufacturing that increases carbon emissions. Additionally, electronic waste poses a critical environmental issue, as the ejection of toxic substances can contaminate soil and water, posing risks to ecology and human health.
Refurbished Electronics: A Greener Alternative Refurbished phones, laptops, or other electronics are a more sustainable option; they demand less resource extraction, energy, and waste production. These devices often consist of components from non-functioning or returned units, thereby not only consuming fewer resources but also reducing their environmental footprint.
Extended Use Reduces Environmental Strain Keeping electronics operating longer through refurbishment diverts them from landfills, which struggle with decomposition, curbing demand for new products and diminishing the environmental toll.
Carbon Emissions and Refurbished Laptops or Phones: While new device production generates substantial greenhouse gases—for instance, manufacturing a smartphone leads to around 85 kg of CO2 emissions—refurbishing lowers this figure, enhancing the ecological friendliness of electronic devices.
Energy Savings with Refurbished Tech Creating new tech products is energy-intensive. Refurbishing, however, is markedly less so; for example, renewing a laptop can use 50 times less energy than manufacturing a new one, largely because refurbishing bypasses the resource-heavy steps of mining and transportation.
Tackling the E-Waste Challenge Over 50 million tons of electronic waste are produced yearly, with many disposed of improperly. Refurbishing and reusing devices help cut down this number, with the potential to shrink both the carbon footprint and e-waste by 30% if a smartphone’s life is just one year longer.
Conserving Material Resources The drive for new devices exhausts scarce elements like rare earth metals. Through refurbishment, the necessity for virgin materials plummets, relieving the pressure on these finite resources.
Moreover, purchasing a pre-owned laptop or phone means you will not receive it with the original packaging, eliminating the need to dispose of any such materials. Packaging waste is a significant environmental issue, as the plastics and Styrofoam that safeguard new electronics can linger in landfills for centuries, often causing pollution long before they degrade. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) reports that 54 million metric tons of electronic waste were produced in 2019, yet only a fraction, two million tons, was recycled. That figure has risen to approximately 59.4 million metric tons by 2022. By opting for used phones, not only is the demand for new phone packaging reduced, but also the amount of waste that contributes to the growing problem of e-waste in our landfills.
Moreover, many pre-owned phones now come unlocked, providing versatility and ease for the consumer. Unlocked phones can be used with various carriers, allowing users to select or switch plans at their convenience. This not only adds a level of freedom for the consumer but also underscores the environmental benefits.
Economic Upsides of Refurbished Tech Cheaper than their new counterparts, refurbished phones or laptops offer an economic advantage as well as environmental, making sustainable choices accessible to more people and lessening the impact of electronic production on the planet.
Refurbished Phones or Laptop Reduces Transportation Pollution Purchasing used phones or laptops can lead to a notable reduction in environmental impact. The transportation of new consumer goods is a major source of pollution, involving substantial fuel consumption by freight vessels and aircraft, along with the use of extensive packaging materials required for safe transit. Opting for used phones diminishes the need for such distribution chains. Moreover, it also curtails the ecological footprint associated with shipping defective returns, thereby playing a significant role in lessening transport-related pollution.
Wrapping up, in the realm of travel essentials, smartphones, and laptops are significantly important for the contemporary traveler. They maintain connections with friends and family, provide navigation, and entertainment, and enable remote work while traveling. Opting for refurbished pre-owned phones or laptops offers cost savings and environmental benefits — it reduces electronic waste and conserves resources, extending the life of electronics and diminishing the need for new manufacturing and raw material extraction, thereby reducing our environmental impact. The majority of refurbished gadgets present a reduced ecological impact when juxtaposed with their new equivalents. Therefore, opting for used phones or refurbished laptop deals in our daily lives allows for substantial environmental benefits, mitigating landfill waste and resource consumption.

author: VNExplorer
title: Gerwyn Price suffers shock Ally Pally exit as Luke Humphries survives huge scare
text:
Fifth seed and former champion Gerwyn Price was dumped out of the World Darts Championship after a 4-2 defeat to Northern Irishman Brendan Dolan.
Dolan held his nerve to close out the match with his first shot at tops after Price had clawed his way back from two legs down to level in the sixth set.
It was a crushing defeat for Welshman Price, who had been intent on repeating his victory in the behind-closed-doors tournament in 2021.
Dolan, who got through his second-round match via a sudden death leg against his compatriot Mickey Mansell, had served an early warning when he took out the opening set with a 144 checkout.
His crisp finishing proved the difference as he nudged in front again at 2-1 on the bull, and 64 to repel Price’s advances to go 3-2 up and one set from victory.
Dolan looked set to be made to pay for missing a match-dart at bull at 2-0 in the sixth when Price hit back to break his throw, but the 50-year-old form Enniskillen saw it home in style.
Dolan told Sky Sports: “I was thinking we might go to a last leg but thank god it didn’t because I don’t know if I would have held myself together.”
Brendan Dolan celebrated one of the biggest wins of his career (Getty Images)
Another of the favourites for the title, Luke Humphries came perilously close to joining Price in an early exit but somehow came from 3-1 down to edge past Ricardo Pietreczko 4-3.
Humphries has been cleaning up at the big events this season to become bookies’ favourite to lift the Sid Waddell Trophy at Alexandra Palace but showed little of that form as, after winning the opening set, he watched his German opponent win nine of the next 12 legs to move just a set away from victory.
When the Englishman was then broken at the start of the fifth set, the game looked to be up, especially as he was seemingly badly affected by a vociferous pro-Pietreczko crowd – many of whom travelled over from Germany – constantly whistling and jeering him.
But he dug deep to break straight back, edged the deciding leg in that set to narrow the gap to 3-2 and then won six of the next seven legs to snatch victory from the jaws of defeat before eschewing his normally mild-mannered approach to exuberantly celebrate in front of those who had been supporting his opponent.
Humphries will now face Joe Cullen in the last 16 and if he does go on to lift the title, may well look back at this narrow escape as the turning point in his championship.
Chris Dobey overcame a scare from Ross Smith to win 4-2 in the highlight of the afternoon session.
A back-and-forth contest that saw 27 maximums posted throughout saw Dobey march into a 2-0 lead before being pegged back by Smith.
Another tight set saw Dobey edge ahead and he hit double 16 for the match to set up a meeting with reigning world champion Michael Smith in the last 16.
Stephen Bunting set up a last-16 clash with Michael van Gerwen after a stunning 4-0 win over Florian Hempel.
Bunting, the former BDO champion, nudged the opener 3-2 and from there the momentum was firmly with him as he swept Hempel away with a whitewash, averaging 101.15 throughout.
Another close contest saw Joe Cullen reach the next round with a 4-2 win over Ryan Searle.
From news to politics, travel to sport, culture to climate – The Independent has a host of free newsletters to suit your interests. To find the stories you want to read, and more, in your inbox, click here.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Heavy Rainfall Halts Flight Operations at Kazi Nazrul Islam Airport | Business
text: Heavy Rainfall Halts Flight Operations at Kazi Nazrul Islam Airport Flight operations at Kazi Nazrul Islam (KNI) airport were suspended due to water logging caused by overnight heavy rainfall. Three flights, including those from New Delhi and Bengaluru, were cancelled. Passengers were informed in advance to minimize inconvenience. Water also inundated approach roads to the airport. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Kolkata | Updated: 02-08-2024 15:24 IST | Created: 02-08-2024 15:24 IST - Country: - India Flight operations to and from Kazi Nazrul Islam (KNI) airport were temporarily suspended on Friday due to significant water logging caused by incessant overnight rainfall, according to officials. Three flights, including one from New Delhi and another from Bengaluru, had to be cancelled due to the weather conditions. An official reported that the area experienced 192 mm of rainfall, leading to the disruptions. Passengers were notified well in advance to minimize inconvenience, as the first flight was scheduled to land at 12.50 pm, authorities confirmed. Water gushed into the airport premises, flooding the operational area, and several sections of the approach road from the highway also experienced inundation, officials added. (With inputs from agencies.) ALSO READ [Union Minister Kiren Rijiju Inaugurates 'Lok Samvardhan Parv' in New Delhi](/article/headlines/3022313-union-minister-kiren-rijiju-inaugurates-lok-samvardhan-parv-in-new-delhi) [Palestinian Delegation to Seek UNESCO Support for Gaza Heritage Site in New Delhi](/article/international/3022727-palestinian-delegation-to-seek-unesco-support-for-gaza-heritage-site-in-new-delhi) [Travel Chaos at Bengaluru Airport Amid Global System Outage](/article/business/3022709-travel-chaos-at-bengaluru-airport-amid-global-system-outage) [Grammy Winners Unite for Bengaluru Airport Anthem](/article/entertainment/3023216-grammy-winners-unite-for-bengaluru-airport-anthem) [The Legends Intercontinental T20 Trophy Unveiled in New Delhi](/article/sports-games/3023386-the-legends-intercontinental-t20-trophy-unveiled-in-new-delhi)

author: malinga
title: D.S. Senanayake and Thurstan record second wins - DailyNews
text:
Unbeaten D.S. Senanayake College Colombo and Thurstan College Colombo recorded second wins and led the points table in day two of the Inaugural Invitational Schools T20 Cricket tournament at Koddaimunai Sports Village (Batticaloa) yesterday.
This tournament was conducted by Koddaimunai Sports Club (KSC) and Koddaimunai Sports Village (KSV) with 4 school teams named D.S. Senanayake College Colombo, Prince of Wales College Moratuwa, Mahinda College Galle and Thurstan College Colombo and one combined team named Emerging Players Programme (EPP XI).
First round of the tournament will conclude on April 6. Leading two teams will advance to the final and 3rd and 4th places will advance to the 3rd place match on April 7.
D.S. Senanayake College Colombo beat Emerging players programme (EPP) XI by 80 runs and Thurstan College Colombo beat Mahinda College Galle by 29 runs in their fixtures of day Two.
Two matches will be held today.
Morning – Prince of Wales College Moratuwa vs Mahinda College
Evening – Thurstan College Colombo vs Emerging players programme
* Match No 3: D.S.Senanayake College Colombo won by 80 runs. D.S. Senanayake College Colombo: 135 (19.3) (Chenul Pinsara 28, Shanel Binushka 25, Chanul Athale 21, Sutharshan Subarnan 4/20, Ahed Al Nahyan 2/26, Tharuka Sooriyarachchi 2/26) EPP XI: 55 (11.2) (Sadew Samarasinghe 22, Randeesha Bandaranayake 3/7, Gaviru Senhas 2/0, Dilash Kumaranayake 2/14)
* Match No 4: Thurstan College Colombo won by 29 runs. Thurstan College Colombo: 124/9 (20) (Thanuga Palihawadana 25 n.o., Shanikya Deshapriya 20, Thanuja Rajapaksa 19, Adithya Sathmina 19, Arosha Udayanga 3/7, Kaveen Rukshan 2/14, Senuka Dangamuwa 2/23) Mahinda College Galle: 95 (18.3) (Pramesh Madubhashana 40, Mulitha De Costa 2/9, Thanuga Palihawadana 2/18).
(YK)

Bridgeville PHOTO: Nicole Sowers Leola PHOTO: Jennifer Raff Gettysburg PHOTO: April Phillips Red Lion PHOTO: Lacey Sieling Orrstown PHOTO: Becky Lee York PHOTO: Amanda Stevens Annville PHOTO: Emily Snavely McVeytown PHOTO: Nicole Swanger PHOTO: Priscilla Fultano There was quite an amazing show in the sky over south-central Pennsylvania on Thursday night. Dozens of News 8 viewers shared photos of the northern lights. Check out some of them in the gallery above. What are the northern lights? The northern lights, or aurora borealis, are a captivating phenomenon characterized by colorful dancing waves of light in the sky. When there is a strong enough geomagnetic storm, the aurora can be seen in Pennsylvania. During these storms, charged particles collide with gases in the earth's upper atmosphere, producing the spectacle. The stronger the geomagnetic storm or larger the amount of material ejected by the sun, the farther south the northern lights can be seen during a storm. Share your photos and videos with WGAL We have several ways you can show us the photos and videos you are capturing. DIRECT UPLOAD: [There is a form here to let you upload photos or video](https://www.wgal.com/upload). EMAIL: Just send to [news8@wgal.com](mailto:news8@wgal.com).
